alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 07 at 11:45AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Widespread heavy rain is forecast to move into the North Gulf Coast that has the potential to cause flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Northeast Prince William Sound. This includes the city of Valdez and Keystone Canyon. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain will begin early Thursday morning and extend through Friday morning. Storm totals through Saturday of 5 to 8 inches are possible in Valdez. Minor to Moderate flooding is possible along area rivers including the Lowe River and tributaries. Flooding is also possible on the smaller streams and creeks that cross the Richardson Highway. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
